list_definition.definition: a small bag sewn into or on to clothes, for carrying things in

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He stood with his hands in his pockets
(also adjective) a pocket handkerchief, a pocket knife.

list_definition.definition: a small bag attached to the corners and sides of a billiard-table etc to catch the balls

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She’s going to pot the black in the middle pocket.

list_definition.definition: a small isolated area or group
(a person’s) income or amount of money available for spending

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a range of prices to suit every pocket.
Be careful he doesn’t pocket the silver.
